2nd session of 10th SPA to be convened
    Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- The presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly (SPA) issued a decree on convening the SPA.   According to the decree dated March 17, the 2nd session of the 10th SPA is to be called here on April 7, Juche 88 (1999).

Russian ambassador gives reception
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Russian delegation
   Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from the delegation of the Foreign Ministry of the Russian Federation on a visit to Korea.   Vice-Minister Grigory Karasin, who is leading the delegation, conveyed the gift to Foreign Minister of the DPRK Paek Nam Sun on Wednesday.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il praised by Indian figure
articles.content:
Russian ambassador gives reception
   Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- Valery Denisov, Russian ambassador to Korea, gave a reception at the embassy on Wednesday on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the signing of the agreement on the economic and cultural cooperation between the DPRK and the Russian Federation.   Invited to the reception were Mun Jae Chol, acting chairman of the Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, Ri In Gyu, vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs, Ri Song Ho, chairman of the Korea-Russia Friendship Association, and other officials concerned.   Present there were the delegation of the Foreign Ministry of the Russian Federation led by vice-Minister Grigory Karasin and officials of the Russian embassy.   Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.content:
Planned lecture by Japanese Prime Minister rejected
    Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- The General Student Council of Korea University declared it would stage a demonstration in protest against the lecture to be given at the university by the Japanese Prime Minister, who is coming to South Korea on March 19, a Seoul-based radio said.   The council is adamantly opposing his planned lecture, maintaining that "new South Korea-Japan relations in the 21st century are unimaginable apart from the latter's repentance and apology for its past.

Preparatory committee formed in Malta
   Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- A meeting for the formation of the Maltese preparatory committee to commemorate Sun's Day was held in Valletta on March 10 on the occasion of the 87th birthday of the President Kim Il Sung.  General secretary of the central committee of the Communist Party of Malta was elected chairman of the committee.  Discussed at the meeting was an issue of organizing colorful functions including a commemoration meeting, lecture meeting and forum on the occasion of Sun's Day.

articles.content:
Merger of public sector unions under KCTU in  S. Korea
    Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- 3 public sector trade unions under the South Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) reportedly held a meeting of deputies in Seoul on Mar. 13 and declared their merger as one body called "National Federation of Public Transport and Service Trade Unions." among them were the federation of public sector trade unions.   The merged federation is the 2nd largest organization under the KCTU, which has 109 unions and more than 100000 unionists.   The KCTU announced that it will continue reorganizing trade unions of different industrial sectors and struggle against the "restructuring" of the authorities with the merged federation as center.

articles.content:
Silk Road tourism in Korea
   Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- The development of a UNESCO-and the Silk Road Promotion Committee of the World Tourist Organization-sponsored Silk Road tourist program is now under way in the DPRK.    The name of Silk Road is derived from the old route of trade and cultural interchange linking the east and west through central Asia.
   From Kojoson (ancient Korea) to Koryo (a feudal Kingdom of Korea), Korean silk, Insam (ginseng) and Koryo celadon made their way to other countries through this route.   Tangun's Korea (Kojoson) was the first producer of silk in the world.   The periods from the 10th to the 13th century witnessed the highest prosperity of trade through the Silk Road in Korea.    The route of the Silk Road tourism covers Pyongyang, Kaesong, and Mt. Myohyang.  Tourists will see historical relics from Kojoson and Koguryo to Koryo and the manufacturing of silk and Koryo Celadon and Insam cultivation.   
   The tourist itinerary is as follows:   Pyongyang: The mausoleum of King Tangun, the Korean History Museum, the Korean Folklore Museum, the tomb murals in Kangso, the Mansudae Art Studio, the mausoleum of King Tongmyong, the site of ovens for Koryo Celadon in Wonsan-ri, South Hwanghae Province.   Kaesong: The Koryo Museum, the mausoleum of King Wanggon, Pyokrando Port along the River Ryesong, the plots under cultivation of Kaesong Koryo Insam.   Mt. Myohyang: Pohyon Temple, Tangun Temple, Tangun cavern, relics related to saint Sosan.

articles.title: Greetings to Namibian President
South African ambassador presents credentials
articles.content:
Greetings to Namibian President 
   Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on March 17 sent a message of greetings to Sam Nujoma, President of Namibia, on the occasion of the 9th anniversary of its independence.   The message took this opportunity to express the belief that the excellent relations of friendship and cooperation existing between the two countries would be strengthened and developed on better terms, and wholeheartedly wished the President and people of Namibia great success in the work for the country's peace, prosperity and development.

South African ambassador presents credentials
    Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- C. Endodebandla Dlamini, newly appointed Ambassador E.P. of South Africa to the DPRK, presented his credentials to Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
